content.heading: SVG Overview
paragraphs: SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) defines XML-based, scalable graphics for the web, integrable with CSS and JavaScript.

content.heading: <svg> Element
paragraphs: The <svg> element is a container for drawing shapes, paths, and text.

content.heading: Drawing Examples
paragraphs: - Circle: <svg width="100" height="100"><circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" /></svg>
- Rectangle: <svg width="400" height="120"><rect x="10" y="10" width="200" height="100" stroke="red" stroke-width="6" fill="blue" /></svg>

- Gradient Ellipse: <svg height="130" width="500"><defs><linearGradient id="grad1"><stop offset="0%" stop-color="yellow" /><stop offset="100%" stop-color="red" /></linearGradient></defs><ellipse cx="100" cy="70" rx="85" ry="55" fill="url(#grad1)" /><text fill="#ffffff" font-size="45" font-family="Verdana" x="50" y="86">SVG</text></svg>

rows: Pixel-based, resolution dependent, suited for games
